moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3 Qa5: The Scandinavian, Black looks to play a Caro-Kann type game.  White will get a lead in development, but if he wants to play for a win he will have to make pawn moves.  While White is making those pawn moves, Black will catch up in development.
moves.4. d4 c6: Premature, Now Black will get seriously behind in development.  Also it is best to wait until White plays Nf3 before playing ....c6.
moves.5. Bc4 Nf6 6. Nge2 Bg4: Black wants to get his ls-bishop out side the pawn chain before playing ...e6.  The other choice ....Bf5 would be met with Ng3.
moves.7. f3 Bh5 8. g4 Bg6 9. h4 h6 10. Nf4 Bh7: The losing move, Black is now fatally behind in development.   Better was ...Nd5.
moves.14. Bxf7+: A lead in development is a temporary thing, so White strikes while the iron is hot.
Black has had enough and resigns.  A possible continuation might be 17...Kd8 18. Ne6+ Kc8 19.Nxc7 Bg8 20.Qxf8 Nxf8 21.Nxa8
